page.title: 08Mark's Church
page.content: Mark is full of old{buildings.}One of the oldest is the{church}which is 730 years old . It was built in 1250 and is made of stone. The{roof}was plastered in 1755 but in 1903 the plaster was taken off and the oak beams were shown. There are 6 bays,aisles,a North Porch and West {Tower}with turrets which contains a {clock}presented by the parishioners to commemorate Queen Victoria's Jubilee. There are 8{bells}which have been broadcast on radio. The last 2 bells were given by the parish in 1945 in memory of those who died in World War 2.One of the treble bells has this inscription:"My sound is good,my shape is neat,Thomas Bayley made me so complete.R.L.CLark 1760."{The stained {glass window}on the East side is very old and unique with a coat of arms on it.The old{buttercross}is in the yard.
